Origins: Given the high price of gasoline these days, the offer of a coupon good for free gasoline makes an excellent lure to be used by someone who wanted to, say, pull a cheap prank on people.
Description: All that needs to be said about this one is that visitors who actually click through on the link provided in the "free gas coupon" e-mails are presented with the following screen:
Example: [Collected via e-mail, September 2008] I subscribe to the "if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is" philosphy. Please comment on this email I got from a friend. I did NOT go to the link. Take advantage of this opportunity! It's about time somebody wanted to help out. It's only for 2 days and you have to have the coupon...so print it off. Free Gas Coupon from Chevron http://clickme.50webs.org/ Received this today. True or scam? Free Gas Coupon from Shell Oil only Click on the link below; you can only use it once... Copy and paste address if it doesn't forward you on to the site..i had todo that! http://clickme.50webs.org/
Claim: Web site offers coupon good for free gasoline.
